Posts.Title: Progression...Navelbine Quest Maya1 Maya1

Posts.Content: Sep 2, 2008 10:23AM Amers wrote: It is okay to be depressed-- I do the date thing, the burial outfit--notes to my kids in a journal for times I don't think I'll be around for them-- Lat night -hubby and I were sitting out on the deck--he said not to go down slowly--live up to the end and then go out with a big bang!  One night a very healthly woman in our neighborhood was hit be a young kid and killed instantly-I knew the mom and the kid who hit her-2 families lives thrown into total turmoil-you never know what is going to happen-life is unfair and unpredictable....so grab all the good you can for now--and I mean this minute--our friends and relatives don't really know where we are....they are confused and helpless Once again I am so glad for this site and the ability to really vent--

Posts.Content: Jun 4, 2008 02:36PM Amers wrote: Nancy- Did it cause you to walk funny--I have a hole in my right femur and I walk like a penguin.   I also now have a sinus infection and feel like I am going to lose it.  Rights leg pain, my liver met is acting up a bit from taking tylenol for my head--I just started Navelbine and can't imagine how knocked out I am going to feel if I get that again on Friday-- Sorry I am whiningggg    --Amers
Posts.Title: Hip Pain nbare1952 wishiwere

Posts.Content: May 2, 2008 06:06AM Amers wrote: Know how you feel-I finished this past monday-28 rounds.  This was after a mastectomy and 6 months of chemo.   I am spent!  Worked throughout-with 3 weeks off for surgery.  It was getting up everyday and going to radiation-then work that was tiring mentally first, then physically.  I got on an antidepressant-helped a lot.  I am normally very "up"!  Each day I picked a person at radiation and prayed for them.  This took the focus off of me and helped me get through it. Amers

Posts.Title: waiting on MRI results Amers Amers

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2008 08:10PM Amers wrote: Thanks Janis-- I got zapped today and have a total of 15 treatements-radiologist is hopeful, since I didn't have any blurred vision-but there are six spots, so he hopes that the radiation will "sterilize" the area. I thank God for you and the message board everyday--it so helps to talk to people who really understand..... Amy
Posts.Title: waiting on MRI results Amers Amers

Posts.Content: Amers wrote: Last few days-I have been really nauseated in the morning-one episode and it passes-onc orderd a brain MRI yesterday-asap--waiting for the results today--I am soooo scared.  First last week's news of progression and now this-- My hubby thinks it is just nerves-I wake up and it hits me--- this is so hard....tests, new drugs, waiting to hear for results....as much as I want to live for my husband and my children-I hate dragging them through all of this....
